intro: Plectritis macroptera, commonly known as the large-leaved filaree, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, lobed leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically yellow and occur in clusters, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Plectritis macroptera thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
